commitResults.messageTitle: Level-0: rename to PRTS, greet and exit
Level-1: echo user input and exit on bye
Level-2: add and list tasks
Add basic task management commands
commitResults.messageBody:
Add support for echoing user input and maintaining an in-memory task list.

Allow users to add tasks, list existing tasks, and update task completion
status using mark and unmark commands.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add todo, deadline and event task types
commitResults.messageBody:
Introduce separate task types for todos, deadlines, and events.

Each task type stores its own time-related fields and formats its output
accordingly when listed.

commitResults.messageTitle: Normalize text UI output for automated testing
commitResults.messageBody:
Remove unstable formatting differences in the text UI output.
This ensures the program output is deterministic so that automated
text-based UI tests can reliably compare expected and actual results.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add error handling for invalid user inputs
commitResults.messageBody:
Users can enter unknown commands, malformed task formats, or invalid
task indices.

Handle such inputs gracefully without crashing, and provide clear and
consistent feedback.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add error handling for invalid user inputs
commitResults.messageBody:
Users can enter unknown commands, malformed task formats, or invalid
task indices.

Handle such inputs gracefully without crashing, and provide clear and
consistent feedback.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add delete command and harden parser/error handling
commitResults.messageBody:
- Implement `delete <index>` to remove a task, shift remaining tasks, and update task count feedback.
- Align add/delete UI messages with the Week 3 examples (Got it... / Noted... + task + count).
- Enforce strict command keyword matching (require whitespace boundary) to avoid accidental matches.
- Add error-specific messages for missing/invalid indices and malformed todo/deadline/event inputs.
- Guard against task array overflow; ignore empty input lines silently.

commitResults.messageTitle: Level-7: add autosave and load from disk
Merge branch 'branch-Level-7'
feat: support parsing and formatting deadline dates
commitResults.messageBody:
Use LocalDate to parse yyyy-mm-dd for deadlines and format with
an explicit Locale for month abbreviations. This enables
Level-8 functionality for date handling and remains backwards
compatible with existing saved files.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Level-8' Integrates Level-8 changes for parsing and formatting deadline dates into the master branch.# Please enter a commit message to explain why this merge is necessary,
refactor: extract ui, storage, parser and task list
refactor: extract UI, storage, parser, and task list classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Refactors the application to improve separation of concerns by
moving user interaction, command parsing, persistence, and task
management logic into dedicated classes.

This simplifies the main class and prepares the codebase for
further extensions and testing.

Organizes the codebase into packages to improve structure and
maintainability.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnit tests for TaskList, Parser, and Deadline
Merge branch 'branch-A-JUnit'
Add JavaDoc comments to public classes and methods
Apply SE-EDU Java coding standard
Add cheer command to show random motivational quotes
Merge branch 'branch-A-JavaDoc'
Merge branch 'branch-A-CodingStandard'
Merge all branches.
Change headers.
Week 4: JavaDoc, coding standard cleanup, Find (Level-9), and Cheer command
commitResults.messageBody:
- A-JavaDoc: Added JavaDoc to public classes/methods across core components (Parser, ParsedCommand, TaskList, Storage, Ui, tasks).
- A-CodingStandard: Reformatted codebase to align with SE-EDU Java coding standard (consistent indentation, spacing, imports, braces).
- Level-9 Find: Implemented `find <keyword>` parsing and execution:
  - Added ParsedCommand.Type.FIND and factory method
  - Parser validates keyword and returns FIND command
  - TaskList.find() returns matching tasks
  - Ui prints matching results in list format
  - PRTS dispatches FIND without mutating storage
- A-Cheer: Implemented `cheer` command that reads from human-readable text file (data/cheer.txt) and prints a random line:
  - Added ParsedCommand.Type.CHEER and factory method
  - Parser recognizes cheer command
  - Storage loads cheer lines with safe fallback when file missing/empty
  - Ui prints selected cheer message
  - PRTS dispatches CHEER without saving tasks
- Git workflow: Completed work on parallel branches and merged back with tags (A-JavaDoc, A-CodingStandard, Level-9, A-Cheer).

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: heavy refactoring to address PR feedback and OOP design
commitResults.messageBody:
This commit performs a comprehensive overhaul of the codebase based on
reviewer feedback. Key changes include architectural
improvements, coding standard compliance, and enhanced robustness.

Architectural & OOP Changes:
- Refactored 'Task' to an 'abstract' class to prevent direct instantiation.
- Added 'abstract String toStorageString()' method in Task to enforce
  consistent storage logic across subclasses and resolve ID ambiguity.
- Renamed 'statusIcon()' to 'getStatusIcon()' and changed visibility to
  'private' as it is an internal helper for 'toString()'.

Coding Standards & Formatting:
- Reordered imports across all files (java.* first, alphabetical order).
- Relocated Javadoc comments to the correct position (after imports).
- Renamed TaskList 'maxSize' to 'MAX_SIZE' to follow CONSTANT_CASE.
- Corrected switch-case indentation in Storage.java Case blocks.
- Added missing File Headers and method Javadocs for all public APIs.

Defensive Programming & Logic:
- Updated TaskList to throw 'IllegalStateException' when full instead
  of silent failure.
- Added 'throws IllegalArgumentException' to TaskList::get method signature.
- Explicitly initialized boolean fields (e.g., isDone = false) in
  constructors to avoid ambiguity.
- Standardized error messages in Parser to provide clearer usage guidance.

Testing & Maintenance:
- Synchronized JUnit tests (TaskListTest, ParserTest, DeadlineTest)
  with the updated API and error message strings.
- Fixed package declaration and imports in DeadlineTest.java.
- Added 'addTask' as the primary method in TaskList, while maintaining
  'add' as an alias for backward compatibility with existing tests.

Add assertions for task list invariants
commitResults.messageBody:
Task operations assume 1-based indices and non-null inputs.
Add assertions to document these invariants and catch violations
early during development.

implementation to improve readability without changing behavior.

previous task list when undo is requested.
